Yes, the fundamental work of agencies involves implementing and interpreting legislative statutes that have already been enacted by Congress.

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.content:
You have selected incorrectly.

The fundamental work of agencies involves implementing and interpreting legislative statutes that have already been enacted by Congress. Issuing a decision after two parties sue each other for breach of contract in federal district court is an activity of the judicial branch. Federal district courts are part of the judicial branch. Administrative agencies may issue decisions, but they are not part of the federal district court system or judicial branch of government.

The President signing into law to create a new administrative agency is not an example of an administrative agency power because it describes the action of the President in creating an administrative agency, but does not describe a power being conducted by an agency itself.
